resources.string: Travel to {POITags} to recover Patricia's Heartgem
Travel to {POITags} to recover Patricia's Cloak
Shadows Cast By A Final Salute
Defeat Captain Patricia to recover her Heartgem. Then retrieve her cloak of office from Slumbering Echoes. Talk to Watcher Sexton in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
I was hoping to see Captain Patricia, but I knew it would be too good to be true.\n\nShe was in charge of the rearguard at Cleaves Malice before the fort was overtaken.

She betrayed us! By the time we realized what was happening, our friends and families had been Corrupted.\n\nWe need you to recover her Heartgem, and reclaim her cloak of office from her estate in Slumbering Echoes.
Patricia has become twisted with Corruption.\n\nShe no longer deserves to have the cloak she received upon becoming a captain. And we can't allow her to keep her Heartgem.

Patricia's Heartgem…See Corruption swirling inside it? 

It finally feels real. She's really gone. 

She was once a fine Soulwarden, and someone very dear to me.

Don’t be. She knew the risks. We all do.

We Soulwardens sometimes forget that we are only protected against Corruption, we aren't immune to it. 

Patricia forgot, and we all paid the price.
Break the defenses of the Corrupted by attacking Cleaves Malice. Talk to Warden Phan in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
Someday, this wretched war with the Corrupted will end!\n\nIt's really taking a toll on us. The sooner we break their defenses, the sooner we can all get back to what really matters in life.

Food, friends, family, life! Take your pick, they're all under threat! 

The Corrupted have cut off one of our major supply routes.

We need you to punch a hole in the guards at Cleaves Malice. Can you do that?

The eager type, are you? I like that!

Have you talked to Warden Sexton? He's also looking for someone to travel to Cleaves Malice. 

Two birds, one stone, yes?
Help us break through the defensive line at Cleaves Malice.\n\nOur forces have taken bad losses, and those of us left need food and medicine to keep up our strength.

You caused a real commotion at Cleaves Malice, {playerName}! A few of our Rangers were able to slip through and deliver the supplies we needed. \n\nIt’s not a permanent fix, but it means we can keep fighting tomorrow!

Wars take time to win, you know. It may not seem like much to you, but for us, it's the difference between a hot dinner and a cold stomachache. That’s worth a lot to my people here. \n\nThanks again, friend.
Travel to {POITags} to slow down the Icefield workers
Slow the Corrupted by defeating Foreman Robertson and his Icefield workers. Talk to Watcher Chang in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
We were expanding the village of Slumbering Echoes…that's where I'm from.\n\nWhen the Corrupted overran it, it was almost too easy for the Corrupted to come and take the lumber.
We need to stop the construction before it becomes impossible to break their defenses.\n\nForeman Robertson is the key there. Take him and his work crew out, and we'll finally have the edge we need.
We need you to defeat the Foreman and his work crew.\n\nOur best strategy is to keep them from expanding their construction.
Nicely done! War is just as much about swinging hammers as swinging blades. \n\nNow that you’ve taken out the Foreman, their defenses are vulnerable. We can exploit that.
Yes, thanks, me too. Still hoping to retire there someday with my family…what's left of it. \n\nJust gotta chase all the Corrupted out first.
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Stolen Supplies
All That's Left Not Torn Asunder
Recover the Stolen Supplies from Sunderfort and deliver them to Soulwarden Phan in the Eastburn Outpost.

string.comment: male referring to female (Captain Patricia), male referring to male (Warden Phan)
string.speaker: Watcher Sexton - Eastburn / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenSexton

resources.string: Right before Patricia’s betrayal, a shipment of our supplies was stolen by Corrupted and taken to Sunderfort. \n\nYou’ve been such a good distraction, they might not have had time to unload it yet.
We had other things on our minds at the time. Everything happened so fast… \n\nWould you be willing to go to Sunderfort and recover the supplies, if they’re still there?
Think of it! Dried fruit, or perhaps even dried fish... New weapons, more armor, fresh shot...!\n\nPlease, find whatever you can in Sunderfort! Anything extra would be helpful.
You were able to recover some of the supplies? That's a load off my mind. \n\nThe world might be ending, but at least we won't go hungry.

Someday, I think. Right now…I just have to take things one fight at a time. 

That’s how she would have wanted it. 

Thanks for everything.
Travel to {POITags} to discover clues about Corrupted activity
Recover Heartgems from the Valleyrend Corrupted in Sunderfort, and find clues about Corrupted activity in the area. Talk to Ranger Knatchbull in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
We paid a steep price in the battle for Sunderfort. Many of our friends were lost. Even worse, Corruption still has them. \n\nI see them when I scout the fort: puppets with the faces of my comrades.

So many Soulwarden puppets in one place means that they’re planning something. I’d like you to search the fort for clues. While you’re there, please lay my friends to rest and recover their Heartgems.
Aside from recovering those Heartgems, we need to find out what the Corrupted are doing at Sunderfort.\n\nThere has to be something keeping them there.

Yes, I recognize these Heartgems. I’ll give them to the Wardens for purification. 

As for me, it’s enough to know that they’re no longer tools of the enemy. 

That’s the best I can do for them, now.

This page you've found... this is written in whatever tongue the Corrupted share.

I can’t read it, but I know someone who can. Maybe we can learn something from all this. 

Thank you, Soulwarden.
Travel to {POITags} to uncover the secret of Corrupted ore

Slow the Corrupted war effort by defeating the Molderpick workers at the Defiler Excavation, and uncover the secret of the Corrupted ore. Talk to Watcher Chang in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.

The Molderpick Corrupted have captured the old iron mine to the west. We’re calling it ‘Defiler Excavation’ now. \n\nBut the weird part is, we got our hands on some of the ore they’re mining there, and it’s...

It’s terrible. You can crush it in your fist, like dirt. 

The iron we used to mine there was perfectly good; something weird is going on. 

Go to the Defiler Excavation and see what you can find out about this ore.
If that ore is iron, it's the worst iron I've ever seen.\n\nWe need to find out more about it, and why the Molderpick workers want it.
You're back! Strange, this ore seems perfectly fine. Strong, even.\n\nAnd you say you found these vials throughout the mines? I wonder what happens when I pour it on the ore…
Yes, just as we thought. Now it’s as weak as the rest. \n\nWhy would the Corrupted do this? Why would they need this shoddy iron dust? There must be something else we're missing.
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Travel to {POITags} to extract Azoth from Ancient statues
Extract Azoth from the fallen Ancient statues
Collect Azoth Infused items from Catara Falls, Gelida Pillars, and Concretus Steps

Is this your first cleansing ritual? I envy you. 

Cleansing a Heartgem consumes azoth, a lot of it. But with all the Corruption here, there’s not enough ambient azoth to pull it off. 

We’ll need to get creative.

That’s what I like to hear. \n\nWe can use azoth-infused items for the ritual. We’re running low on them… and everything else… but you may find what's needed in the remains of the fallen Ancient statues.
Catara Falls, Gelida Pillars, and Concretus Steps all have what we need to purify the Heartgems.\n\nWatch out for the Ancient Guardians, they mean business.
Oh, my, impressive! You've manage to gather all the materials we need to purify the Heartgems.\n\nThose Guardians didn't give you too much trouble, did they?
That’s what I figured. You’re strong, {playerName}, in more ways than one. \n\nI hope that if I ever fall to Corruption, there will be someone like you around to do this ritual for me.
Search for traces of Warden Sexton
Search for more traces of Warden Sexton
Locate the missing Soulwarden Sexton, and report his whereabouts to Warden Dimka in the Cleave's Point Outpost.

string.comment: male referring to male (him = Liam), male referring to female (Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Warden Phan - Eastburn / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenPhan

resources.string:
Can I just say again how much I love your can-do attitude? 

Anyway, Warden Sexton went to deliver a message to Cleave’s Point, and he hasn’t come back. It’s not like him. 

Could you go find him?

Oh, not me. It’s Dimka. She’s devoted to him, and she’s been so worried. Won’t eat, won’t sleep…

I’m more worried about her than him, to be honest. 

Please, find Sexton and help me put Dimka’s mind at rest.
With the losses we've suffered, every person is vital.\n\nNot to mention Soulwarden Dimka would be crushed to hear something happened to Sexton.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: You have letters for me?\n\nOdd, I've never met you before and I think I would have remembered you.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string:
Oh, James, no…How could this have… 

Wait. These love letters…they’re not addressed to me. They’re all addressed to Patricia. 

So he really did love her…Spark, I feel like such a fool right now.
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Secret Caches
Travel to {POITags} to recover the Secret Caches
Recover the Secret Caches at Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion. Talk to Soulwarden Dimka in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: Please, don’t. You mean well, but the last thing I need right now is pity. \n\nJames…Warden Sexton…his letters weren’t all love letters. There’s a report in here that says that the Corrupted are stockpiling ammunition.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string:
Yes, you absolutely can. That ammunition would be far better off in our hands.

The report says they’re smuggling it in fake barrels and burying it at Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion.

If you find it, bring it here.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Breakaway Fort and Acedia Bastion have secret ammo caches located in false containers, and have likely buried some already.\n\nI don't want to think about James right now.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string:
What’s that? Oh, the ammunition. Sorry, I was miles away.

Yes, this is it. This ammunition should carry us through the next few raids.

Thank you, Soulwarden.

string.speaker: Warden Dimka - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenDimka

resources.string: I don’t know. I need to think.\n\nThanks for everything, but…this is something no one can help me with.

string.comment: itemName = "Breakaway Fort Heartgem" / "Acedia Bastion Heartgem" / "Hollowing Fort Heartgem" / "Nullcavity Heartgem" , POI = "Breakaway Fort" / "Acedia Bastion" / "Hollowing Fort" / "Nullcavity"
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Recover Soulwarden Heartgems from the Corrupted. Search for clues about the Corrupted plans in Breakaway Fort, Acedia Bastion, Hollowing Fort, and Nullcavity. Talk to Ranger Law in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: It’s… not ideal, no. It’s also not great that those forts are full of Corrupted Soulwardens. \n\nOur comrades and friends, who fought and fell beside us… They and the forts both belong to Corruption now.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Ah, but now, things are different. Now, we’ve got you. \n\nCould you please try and recover Heartgems from my Corrupted friends at the forts? And while you’re there, keep an eye out for clues, weaknesses, secrets.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Please, return with any Heartgems you can in Acedia Bastion, Breakaway Fort, Hollowing Fort, and Nullcavity.\n\nI hope you'll also find more evidence about what the Corrupted are up to, or even more of those strange symbols.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: You brought back the Heartgems! Oh, wonderful. Now my friends won't be tortured anymore. \n\nYou also found… symbols? I’ve seen these before...the Corrupted carve them on the floating obelisks.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string:
The Heartgems, we will purify. It’s really quite a beautiful ceremony. 

As for these papers, I’ll send them along to my friend. She’s working to crack the code, you see. Someday, she’ll succeed. 

Thank you so much.
Travel to the {POITags} to recover Azoth-Infused Lanterns

string.comment: itemName = "Azoth Infused Lantern" , targetName = "Miststride" , POI = "Wayward Mounds" (Region)
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Recover Azoth-Infused Lanterns from Miststride Ghouls in the Eeriedune Graveyard and Misty Borough. Talk to Watcher Owens in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Have you heard of the ghost lights, the ignes fatui, the lanterns that flicker in the Eeriedune Graveyard?\n\nNever filled, never fueled, always burning? I need to learn more about their properties!

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: The Corrupted don't go near them. If we can find out why, maybe we can harness their protection as well! n\nYou can find the lanterns at the Eeriedune Graveyard and in Misty Borough. Please, hurry back!

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Return the lanterns to me, so I can uncover their secrets.\n\nThey are quite distinct, you should have no problem following their glow.

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: The lanterns... There's no light, no glow, not even a flicker! Yet you say they are not broken...\n\nWhatever causes them to glow must come from the Ghouls themselves...

string.comment: chaíre = hee-YE-re, Greek for "see you soon"
string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string:
I plan on taking the lanterns apart to see how they work, of course.

Perhaps if we find a way to light them, they'll still hold the Corrupted at bay. 

Thank you, chaíre, see you again soon.

string.comment: itemName = "Blackened Talisman" , targetName = "Miststride Flailer" , POI = "Eeriedune Graveyard"
string.speaker: UI – Tracker Text

resources.string: Travel to {POITags} to determine if Herald Abraxas will aid the Soulwardens
Travel to {POITags} to stop Herald Abraxas
Search for '​Pictures On The Wall' entry
Discover how Herald Abraxas blessed Misty Borough, and determine if the Heralds will aid the Soulwardens. Talk to Watcher Magoro in the Cleave's Point Outpost when the task is complete.

string.comment: male referring to male (holy Herald = Herald Abraxas)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: It does, doesn’t it? I’ve been hearing stories about the Misty Borough and Herald Abraxas since I was a child. He’s my hero. \n\nIf only we had someone like him on our side in this fight…the war would be over tomorrow!

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Yes, the Herald, that's him! The legends say that he and his followers arrived in Misty Borough, seeking paradise. \n\nYou know, they might still be there. How wonderful that would be. Maybe they could even fight with us!

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: If it's true, and the Herald's sacred power truly does protect his village from Corruption, perhaps we could use it across the island!\n\nHe could bless all of Great Cleave and drive the Corrupted right back into the mountain they crawled out of!

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Ah! You're back! Will Herald Abraxas help us in the fight against the Corrupted?\n\nDid you discover how the hilltop is protected?
"Yes, but you're not going to like it."

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string:
Oh…I see. They’re protected from Corruption because they were Lost long ago. 

 In any case, thank you. I’ll destroy these talismans. 

I guess some legends are better off staying legends.
Travel to {POITags} to recover stolen Heartgems
Defeat Gravespoil Vicars in Capitulum Prime, and return the stolen Heartgems to Watcher Owens in the Cleave's Point Outpost.

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Yes, both! Rangers have reported the theft of a cache of Corrupted Heartgems. The same Heartgems you recovered from our former comrades at the fallen forts! \n\nI knew we shouldn’t have kept them all in one place…

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: The Gravespoil Vicars who haunt Capitulum Prime…los odio, I hate them. We think they’re using them in some kind of ghoulish ritual. \n\nI’m sorry to ask you recover the same Heartgems twice, but…please get them back!

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: We can't let the Gravespoil Vicars use those Heartgems in their rituals.\nThose were our friends, and we owe it to them to keep their souls safe!

string.comment: female referring to female (Warden = Warden Dimka)
string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: You’re back! Did you recover the Heartgems? Or were we too late?

string.speaker: Watcher Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: Oh, thank the Spark. Yes, they’re all here…my old friends. I’d recognize them anywhere. \n\nThank you so much, {playerName}. I will be having serious words with whoever was storing all these Heartgems in one place.
Travel to {POITags} to defeat former Soulwarden Sauquillo Dimka
Defeat former Soulwarden Sauquillo Dimka, and return her Heartgem to Watcher Magoro in the Cleave's Point Outpost.

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Ever since you brought the news of Sexton’s death…and, um, romantic betrayal…Dimka couldn’t take it. She was so sad, and angry, and embarrassed…in her despair, Corruption took her.

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string:
I wish I could have helped her. I know you do, too. 

When she realized what was happening, she fled north. She didn’t want to hurt us. 

We think she got as far as Sever Castra, before she... oh, Dimka…

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: I’m sorry to ask for your help once again, but…you seem so strong. And you didn’t know Dimka like we did. Maybe that will make this easier. \n\nPlease, bring back her Heartgem. She deserves that much.

string.comment: male referring to female (her = Archaeologian Sauquillo)
string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: That's Dimka’s Heartgem. It's hard to believe that she's gone…\n\nShe was brilliant, kind, vibrant... and now, she's some twisted and Corrupted thing. Is this the fate that awaits us all?

string.speaker: Watcher Magoro - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenMagoro

resources.string: Yes…you’re right. This is why it’s so important for us to keep our spirits as high as we can…because if we don’t…\n\nThank you. I’ll lay Dimka’s purified Heartgem to rest next to Sexton’s…and Patricia’s.
Deliver Orders to Soulwarden Ducquet of Valor Hold Outpost in Edengrove. Talk to Warden Yseult in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.

string.speaker: Warden Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string: If you're willing to continue helping the Soulwardens, there's another place that could really use it.\n\nIn Edengrove is the Valor Hold Outpost. They’re in the belly of the beast over there.

string.speaker: Warden Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: WardenOwens

resources.string:
So much. Food, arms, reinforcements. Above all, they could use some good news. That’s you. 

Take this letter to Warden Ducquet in Valor Hold. Stick to the roads, though they're not much safer. 

Auf wiedersehen, my friend.

string.speaker: Warden Owens - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave

resources.string: Remember, stick to the path.\n\nSoulwarden Ducquet will certainly be surprised to see you... I don't believe they've had outside news in months.
Your compass is backwards if you're heading for safety. You want safety, head for the coasts!\n\nOrders from Soulwarden Owens? Let's have a look then…
Says you've bested a good measure of those Corrupted in Great Cleave, and you're here to help.\n\nWe could use the help, sure enough. Let's find something for you to do!
Gather supplies for Ranger Law to make Prime Resolve.
Gather a Pulsing Staff Stem from Corrupted at Scorpius.
Gather Vortex Funnel from Corrupted at Svikin's Stand.
Gather Flint Flamestarters from Undead at Periville.
Gather Blistering Reagents from Corrupted at Greater Tribulation.
Gather a Curved Staffhead from Angry Earth at Eridanus.
Gather a Swirling Staff Base from Angry Earth at Malevolence.
Gather Orichalcum Flintlock from Undead Pirates at Stone Skull Fort.
Defeat High Priest Oseguera in the Mangled Heights for an Azoth Concentrator.
Complete Quest: Growth From the Stem
Complete Quest: Head of the Pack
Seek a stem for your staff at {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Pulsing Staff Stem", target = S'ylanx the Unseen
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Venture to {POITags} in search of a Vortex Funnel
Claim a head for your staff from the Dryads of {POITags}
Climb the tower {POITags} in search of a base for your staff
Delve into the {POITags} in search of an Azoth Concentrator

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Here in Aeternum, where doom haunts our every move, we must hang on to the things that make us feel alive.\n\nTo that end, there is a legend we tell in Great Cleave that warms our hearts.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string:
There is a powerful fire staff, called Prime Resolve.

The legend goes that it can turn a Corrupted enemy to cinders in a flash. 

I’d call that heartwarming, wouldn’t you?

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Yes, if you make it so! Go forth and gather the parts needed to build this legendary weapon!\n\nSetting things on fire, what a wonderful way to remind yourself you're truly alive.

string.speaker: Ranger Law - Cleave's Point / Great Cleave
string.name: RangerLaw

resources.string: Isn’t fire wonderful? It keeps us warm, cooks our food, burns away the darkness and the filth and the pain… \n\nOnce you craft your own fire staff, you’ll understand.
At last, Prime Resolve is completed. It’s beautiful. Truly a force to be reckoned with!\n\nKnowing you wield it will keep me warm during my cold patrols.
"I'll burn a few Corrupted in your name."
You're too kind. May Prime Resolve turn you into a beacon of fiery hope.\n\nA burning flame that refuses to go out as it purifies Corruption.

Gather the parts, wholesome and true, for a life-giving staff made whole. Glittering, gleaming, restore and renew the Glimmering Mercy's soul. Talk to Ranger Madaki in Shattered Mountain when the task is complete.

string.comment: male referring to female (Ranger Madaki), male referring to male (Ranger Rochford)
string.speaker: Ranger Balogun - Great Cleave
string.name: RangerBalogun

resources.string: That place has eaten many careless Soulwardens. Your accomplishment is impressive…to some. \n\nBut no one triumphs alone, do they? I’ve heard you’ve been getting help from my friend Madaki in Shattered Mountain.
"We all need help, now and then."

Some of us. 

Madaki said you've made a discovery about the Corrupted's weaponry. Let's see the pages you've found.

Oh! The plans for this staff, Glimmering Mercy, are actually a song. That’s whimsical.

The plans are a collection of short bits compiled into a poem called the "Symphony of Mercy."\n\nIf you're serious about practicing Life Magic, follow these lyrics to get your hands on the Glimmering Mercy.

Getting lost in song is quite easy, which explains Rochford. Maybe I myself should follow his tune a little more!\n\nIf you're confused on your path, check the scribbled notes in your Journal and follow the symphony.

So, you've learned the Symphony of Mercy? I won't pretend to know the work of musicians, but I can at least whistle a tune as I work.\n\nGive me a moment to extract the essences I need, and I'll finish crafting the Mercy.

Yes, this is a fine Life Staff. Just seeing it glimmer puts my heart at ease. Wielding the Mercy in battle will inspire awe in your allies and fear in your enemies.\n\nTake it, in your hands I know this staff will do some good.
Blood-stained robes and cursed staves, nefarious acolytes raise their minions forth. Find them in the heights west by north, and send them to their cursed graves.
Weeping trees, they be not willow nor withe, growing wild in the winding way. Survive the wanton whaling of the forestwalkers, and your woes be rewarded with the trees' blue tears.
Another place, another body, another time, the wisest of shamans are not of here but a reality that bends. The myrrh they carry is their vehicle, the key to a magic that transcends.

One swig for courage, two swigs to sleep, three swigs to settle your strife, and four swigs when under the knife. Give me that bottom of the barrel wine, freshly butchered swine, and a wench for a good time.
The red eye of the bay, the red eye of the bay, the tower calling sailors to their doom. Deep in the tower, hidden away, an ancient and powerful rune.
Temporary forms made immortal and pinned to the earth in sorrow. The faithless turn their back on the path.
In the heart of the craters, the soul of Aeternum, climb towards the sky. Peek into the mirror and learn the ways of those that defend the tower.
Dive into the belly of the beast, and the heart of Corruption. Though light may cast out the darkness, it in turn casts a shadow.
Ascend into the {POITags} in search of Corrupted Wood shards
Collect Infernal Corrupted Wood shards from Unhallowed Devouts
Collect Perfected Wyrdwood Tears from {targetName} Dryads
Venture to {POITags} to collect Fragrant Incense
Collect Stone Skull Port from {targetName} Pirates
Defeat Joan the Faithless for her Broken Talisman
Ascend the tower {POITags} in search of Elemental Crystals
Search chests within {POITags} for Elemental Crystals
Tear down Enchanted Vines along the walls of Malevolence
Infiltrate the {POITags} in Myrkgard for a Talisman of Protection
Defeat a Myrkgard Priest for their Talisman of Protection
Complete Quest: Prelude of the Acolytes
Complete Quest: Zarabanda del Ojo Rojo
Complete Quest: Requiem of the Lost
Complete Quest: Passepied de la Tour
Complete Quest: Sonata of the Shattered
Complete Quest: By Root and Bough
Complete Quest: A Sample of Evil
Complete Quest: Shards From Above and Below
Complete Quest: Wooden Hearts and Iron Heads
Complete Quest: Sticking to the Plan
Recover the components needed to create the Azure Ravager, and deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
I know. I started seeing the influx of strange items coming into the forts nearby, and I didn't question her any longer.\n\nSomething unusual was going on, so I started to look into it.
There is an amazing hatchet, I'm sure Madaki showed you. I can imagine the way it handles in a fight!\n\nWe can't let the Corrupted make it first!

I've put together a list of everything that matches up with this new Hatchet design.\n\nYou'll have to search across Aeternum for some of the items, but I'm certain you can do it. You found me up here, after all.
I’d love to join you, but I have other duties. I have to try and stop any more of those supplies from reaching the forges in Caminus.\n\nI’m sure you can find all the items on that list by yourself!
Glad you made it back. Wow, some of this stuff must have been hard to find. Nicely done.\n\nGive me a bit to integrate these last components you've brought, and we'll see what we end up with.

This is no ordinary hatchet! Whoever designed it was a master smith. 

A name is coming to me: Azure Ravager, the slayer of Corrupted. 

Yes, that’s got a nice ring to it!
Explore {POITags} in search of a Starmetal Whetstone
Collect a Starmetal Whetstone from Brightwood Isle.
Obtain an Evergreen Dryad Branch from {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Dryad Archer Rubble" , targetName = "Belfrian Archer" , POI = "Umbrage"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect the Rubble from the bodies of Dryad Archers in Eridanus, and obtain an Evergreen Dryad Branch from their leader.
Eliminate the Monstrous Corrupted gathered near Corruption Breaches
Locate Corruption Breaches throughout Aeternum, and cut down the hordes of Monstrous Corrupted who gather there.
Venture to {POITags} in search of a Desecrated Azoth Crystal

string.comment: itemName = "Desecrated Azoth Crystal" , targetName = "Sylanx the Ugly" , POI = "Scorpius"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Deep within Scorpius, take back the Desecrated Azoth Crystal from S'ylanx the Unseen
Obtain Everburning Embers and Tainted Orichalcum samples from {POITags}
Find samples of Tainted Orichalcum and collect Everburning Embers from Ambusti Superior. Talk to Ranger Madaki in Shattered Mountain when the task is done.

string.comment: itemName = "Corrupted Iron Hammerhead" , targetName = "Elite Southguard Forger" , POI = "Svikins Stand"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Gather {itemName} from Wyrdwood trees across Aeternum
Collect Corrupted Iron Hammerheads from the Elite Southguard Forgers of Svikin's Stand.
There are still a few more items on Fowler's shopping list, and I still have a lot to do to make sure this Hatchet won't do anything crazy, like try and suck your soul out.\n\nKidding... I think.
Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what will happen when this weapon is finished.\n\nAll I do know for certain is that we'll have it and they won't... and that'll hurt them in more ways than one.
You bring me the components, and I'll get this thing made. The faster you bring everything back, the faster you can use this weapon on those damned Corrupted.

It looks like you've made a lot of progress already! I've been working to alter this recipe to channel azoth instead of Corruption... and with what you've brought me, I think I'll be able to make this work.
By the time you bring back the rest of the components, I'll have most of the critical pieces complete.\n\nThen we'll get to see what this design can really do.
Venture into {POITags} in search of Ethereal Adhesive and Unstable Azoth Shards
Seek out Unstable Azoth Shards and Ethereal Adhesive from the Lost of Periville.

string.comment: itemName = "Starmetal Whetstone" , targetName = Elite Grubby Rebels Berserker" , POI = "Stone Skull Fort"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: A great haul, wonderfully done! While you've been out, I was able to stop three other shipments from making their way to the forges of Caminus.\n\nFelt good to be up and active, you know?
Oh, Ranger Madaki sent a runner earlier, in case you stopped by. She's almost completed the Hatchet, and it looks like with what you have, she'll have the final pieces she needs. Hurry up there!
Collect Drowned Silver Coins hoarded by the Skullworm Pirates of Stone Skull Fort. Talk to Ranger Fowler in Great Cleave when the task is complete.
Complete Quest: Bones of the Past
Complete Quest: Into the Burning Depths
Recover the components needed to create the Rampant Conviction, then deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.

I've received her instructions, and have set my efforts to stopping the production of Corrupted weapons.\n\nTo that end, I've compiled reports to track the weapons that have recently passed through the valley.
It needed to be done. It's safe to assume that most, if not all, of the items are related to the creation of this Hammer.\n\nI've organized them into a list for you, to aid you in your endeavor.
You're welcome. I shall continue my efforts to stop the Corrupted here.\n\nI leave the rest in your capable hands. Best of luck.
Be watchful, stick to the shadows, and don’t move until you need to. This tactic has served me well over the years. \n\nIt will serve you too, if you embrace it.
Didn't get too lost out there, I hope?\n\nLet's take a look at what you brought me, hm? Oh, yes... these will do nicely for what's needed.

Indeed. A beautiful weapon. It needs a name...

I've got it! The Rampant Conviction of Hope. A little long, but I like it. 

Take it, and show those Corrupted just how strong our hope is.
Loot Pirate Token Pouches from Stone Skull Fort.

string.comment: itemName = "Pirate Token Pouch" , targetName = "Grubby Rebels" , POI = "Stone Skull Fort"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect {itemName}es from the Elite {targetName} in {POITags} in Cutlass Keys

string.comment: itemName = "Goldsteins Scales" , targetName = "Goldstein the Hypocrite" , POI = "Stone Skull Fort"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect Pirate Token Pouches from the Elite Grubby Rebels of Stone Skull Fort, and recover Goldstein's Scales from Goldstein the Equalizer.
Obtain Veil Leather from the Corrupted throughout Scorpius.
Venture to {POITags} in search of bone dust
Retrieve bone dust from caskets in Periville
Obtain Vinesnap's Heart from within Eridanus

string.comment: itemName = "Dryad Fighter Vines" , targetName = "Dryad Soldier" , territoryID = "Restless Shore"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Obtain Vinesnap's Heart from within Eridanus, and collect Dryad Fighter Vines from the Eridanite Dryads.
Slay an Unhallowed Tendril in the Mangled Heights

string.comment: itemName = "Corrupted Tendril Stalk" , targetName = "Elite Unhallowed Tendril"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Gather {itemName} from Starmetal deposits throughout Aeternum
Collect a stalk from an Elite Unhallowed Tendrils in the Mangled Heights.
Retrieve Contaminated Ore from Ambusti Superior
Retrieve Contaminated Ore from chests in Ambusti Superior.
Eliminate the Monstrous Corrupted gathered near Corruption Breaches
Locate Corruption Breaches throughout Aeternum, and cut down the hordes of Monstrous Corrupted who gather there.
Great work, {playerName}. I haven’t been idle either. \n\nEight caravans attempted to bring additional supplies through the valley…they will not reach their destinations.
Some items were clearly to be used for this Hammer, among other weapons.\n\nNo matter. Return these components to Ranger Madaki, and she will work to create a weapon of note.
Obtain the Living Crystal from the monstrous Dryad at the peak of Malevolence
Obtain the {itemName} from the Dryad Beast, {targetName}
Obtain the Living Crystal from the monstrous Dryad at the peak of Malevolence. Talk to Ranger Knatchbull in the Eastburn Outpost when the task is complete.
Gather components to make the Legendary Ice Gauntlet Rimelash.
Gather the Corrupted Bindings that will hold together the gauntlet from Legatus General Patrick at Svikin's Stand. Talk to Ranger Madaki at Shattered Mountain.
Gather the Frozen Orichalcum Plating from the frozen crown of North Myrkgard, Greater Tribulation.
Gather the Chilled Fungi that grows upon the Elite Alcazarian Guardians of Malevolence for an extra kick of frost.
Kill Corrupted on the way to gather S'ylanx the Unseen's frozen, twisted heart to make a core for the gauntlet.
Gather Frostforged Grips to make up the hand of the gauntlet from the Corrupted of Caminus.
Gather Everbite Ectoplasm from the wraiths of frigid Periville, their cold everlasting in undeath.
Gather Icy Shot from the Skullworm Pirates of Stone Skull Fort, a special ammunition they keep on them for inflicting maximum pain.
Defeat Dryads and their leader Parthenocissus for his Frostbitten Vine that will wrap around the core of the gauntlet.
"You aren't just talking about the weather..."

Just think of it, holding the power of a snowstorm in one's hand. \n\nThere's a weapon that allows for this and more, the gauntlet Rimelash. With it you can freeze enemies and shatter their frozen forms.
It is! Rimelash's cold seeps into the very marrow of an enemy, freezing them from the inside-out. \n\nThis is exactly the kind of weapon we could use, if you're willing to take on its construction.
Great Cleave is a wonderful place, if you seek the power of winter. The creatures here have ice in their veins – take it from them. \n\nOnce you get the pieces, Madaki can help you put them together.
This land is full of shifting forces greater than all of us. But we won’t be afraid. We will master them, in time. \n\nGo, master the power of winter, and bring Rimelash into the world once more.
What a resounding success! I present to you: Rimelash, the instrument of icy destruction that will freeze and fell your enemies before they even know what's hit them!
It is a great boon to have this weapon in the hands of someone so capable.\n\nThe Corrupted will shatter under its power.
Complete Quest: Blood in the Snow
Infiltrate {POITags} in search of Corrupted Bindings
Seek out Frozen Orichalcum Plating from {POITags} in Myrkgard
Gather the Chilled Fungi that grows upon Dryad Guardians of {POITags}
Tear down Enchanted Vines along the walls of Malevolence
Search {POITags} for a core for the gauntlet
Claim Frostforged Grips from the Corrupted of Caminus
Gather Everbite Ectoplasm from the wraiths of Periville
Delve into {POITags} in search of Icy Shot
Infiltrate {POITags} and slay its leader for a Frostbitten Vine
